intro: Pedilonum putnamii, commonly known as the Putnam's pedilonum, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are small and white or pale green. Due to habitat loss, Pedilonum putnamii is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
